CatDescriptText: The New Granada Theater, an art deco former movie house, built in 1927, is located at 2009-13 Centre Avenue in the Hill District.  The movie theater occupied the first floor, and on the second floor was the Savoy Ballroom which was used for performances by such musicians as Billy Eckstine, Cab Calloway, and other eminent performers of the time.  The sign on the theatre marquee reads: [P]LAY S[...]EENO EVE[RY] SAT-NITE.  A fire truck stands by the curb.  In the background is a sign for "Rosen's Beer Liquor Wine Dine" and the 85 Bedford trolley.  A police man patrols the sidewalk and a crowd gathers in the street.
TitMainTitle: Fire at the New Granada Theatre, Centre Avenue, Hill District
